Description: Fragment of plain weave textile, propably a curtain; Undyed linen with areas of tapestry (on grouped threads) in coloured wool (red, yellow, green, dark blue, pink, brown); Soumak outlining to tapestry; Largest tapestry motif is a roundel with a frame of flowers and petals around a haloed half-figure - a personification or a Christian saint; Also in tapestry are small dots, petals or buds, and stylised baskets of fruit; Warp: linen, S spun, c.14 tpc; Weft: linen and wool, S spun, c.19 tpc in plain areas, c.45 tpc in tapestry; Edges: ragged.
Curator's comments: Previous location Cupboard 64, red box; Probably a domestic item (curtain), not clothing. While scattered design suggests a relatively early date (compare 7th century Textiles detla la biyeh, R. Pfister, Paris, 194?) soumak outlining (on the central figure) is generally found on tapestry designs which relate to 8th-10th century Byz. silks. Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (16.5.1990)
Condition: Fragmentary, but otherwise fair, colours good; stuck to sticky net (date unknown)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Maj William Joseph Myers (executors of)
